title: Defining Relative Clauses: Essential Details
objectives: Understand Relative Clauses Defining at Beginner level
Apply Relative Clauses Defining in real conversations
Build confidence with Relative Clauses Defining

vocabulary.definition: Refers to people. Example: The teacher who teaches math.
Refers to objects or animals. Example: The book which I bought.
Refers to people or things. Example: The car that is red.
Shows possession. Example: The girl whose bike is new.
Refers to places. Example: The city where I was born.

content.introduction: Welcome to this lesson on Relative Clauses Defining.
content.explanation: In this lesson, you will learn about Relative Clauses Defining at the Beginner level.
examples: Example of Relative Clauses Defining usage.
tips: Practice Relative Clauses Defining daily for best results.

exercises.question: Choose the correct word: The movie ____ I watched last night was fun.
The student ____ won the award is very talented.
Describe a person or place using a defining relative clause.

culturalNote: Relative clauses are common in American English for giving important details, especially in formal and written contexts.
